ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

0 = Absent; 1 = Minimal. Very mild sx or only suspected; 2 = Moderate. Definite, clinically significant sx; 3 = Severe. Clearly interferes with function or preoccupies subject; 4 = Very severe. Gross and/or nearly constant effect on function

0 = No poverty of content of speech ; 1 = Mild poverty of content of speech; 2 = Moderate poverty of content of speech; 3 = Severe  poverty of content of speech; 4 = Extreme poverty of content of speech
0 = No pressure of speech ; 1 = Slight pressure of speech; 2 = Moderate pressure of speech; 3 = Severe pressure of speech; 4 = Extreme pressure of speech
0 = Absent; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe; 4 = Extreme
0 = No tangentiality; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Extreme
0 = No derailment; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe; 4 = Extreme
0 = No incoherence; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe; 4 = Extreme
0 = No illogicality; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe; 4 = Extreme
0 = No clanging; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe; 4 = Extreme
0 = Absent; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe
0 = Absent; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe
0 = No circumstantiality; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe
0 = No loss of goal; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe
0 = No preservation; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe
0 = Absent; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe
0 = Absent; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe
0 = No stilted speech; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe
0 = Absent; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe
0 = No instances of phonemic paraphasia; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe; 4 = Extreme
0 = No instances of semantic paraphasia; 1 = Mild; 2 = Moderate; 3 = Severe; 4 = Extreme
0 = No TLC disorder; 1 = Mild TLC disorder; 2 = Moderate TLC disorder; 3 = Severe TLC disorder; 4 = Extreme TLC disorder

ElementDescription: Summative score, derived by doubling "More Pathological" scores and adding them to the "Less Pathological" scores
